intro: Callichlamys garnieri, commonly known as the red-flowered callichlamys, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red petals and yellow stamens, which make it visually distinctive. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The flowers are pollinated primarily by birds and insects, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
